page.title: 07POPULATION AND SETTLEMENT
page.content: To the south of the Block lies the settlements of Sidbury and Sidford. Both are{Nucleated}and Sidbury has a classic Anglo-Saxon "star shape" form. The population of the block is small (probably around 100) and settlement is{dispersed.}Isolated farms and private houses lie about half a mile apart with the exception of five large pre-war houses close to the main road. In Roncombe,{Mincombe Farm}and{Knapp {Farm}occupy sites near the valley floor. Between the 8th and 15th centuries these deep wooded valleys were slowly cleared of timber and the higgledy-piggledy fields and narrow lanes laid down. Knapp farm was first mentioned in 1280 as "la Cnapp in manerio de Sydebir". Mincombe Farm is recorded in the Episcopal Register of the Diocese of Exeter in 1313. Wolvers -leigh Farm has{Domesday}mention.
